sources.title: 7 Best Tools for Multilingual Real-Time Translation in Video Calls
sources.snippet: One of the most notable tools for multilingual real-time translation in video calls is Zoom's Live Transcription & Interpretation feature. This tool utilizes AI to provide live captions and translations, making video calls more accessible.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Yes ‚Äî there are live translation options you can use with video calls on platforms like Zoom and Microsoft Teams. They fall into a few categories: built-in features and third-party tools. üîπ Built-in & Native Options Zoom Live Translation / Interpretation ‚Äì Zoom supports real-time translation via its interpretation features and live captions (text). You can assign language channels for participants to listen in another language. Fora Soft

citation_mappings.claim_text: Microsoft Teams Live Captions & Translated Subtitles ‚Äì Teams can show real-time translated captions (speech-to-text in another language), although full voice translation may require a Premium plan or recent AI interpreter rollout. jotme.io+1

citation_mappings.claim_text: Kudo / Boostlingo / others ‚Äì Tools offering live speech translation and interpretation, sometimes combining AI and human interpreters. jotme.io
Caption & Post-meeting Translation Tools like Tactiq can capture live transcripts and then translate them into target languages (text-only). Tactiq

üìå Points to Consider Accuracy & latency vary widely ‚Äî machine translation may lag or misinterpret slang/technical terms. Voice-to-voice translation (AI recreating spoken output) is emerging (e.g., Teams AI interpreter), but still rolling out. theverge.com
